overview.title: Project Overview
description: Block Burst is a casual puzzle game where players drag and place block pieces onto a grid to complete full rows or columns. The goal is to score as high as possible by clearing lines efficiently while managing limited space. The game ends when no available block can be placed on the board.
Designed for quick play sessions, Block Burst emphasizes clarity, satisfying feedback, and strategic spatial thinking. It is fully playable offline and suitable for players of all ages.

design.title: Project Design
coreGameplay: Players are given a set of 3 block pieces each turn.
Blocks are placed onto a 8x8 grid via drag-and-drop.
Completing full rows or columns clears it from the board.
The game continues endlessly until no valid placement remains.
scoringSystem: Points are awarded for each cleared row or column.
Multiple line clears in a single move grant bonus points.
Optional combo or streak multipliers added for advanced play.
Perfect placing earns more bonus points.
Clearing the whole board grants huge points and changes the game theme.
logicFlow: Start with an empty grid or random pattern
Receive a set of 3 block pieces from algorithm
Clear lines to create space and earn points
Repeat until no moves are possible
Display final score and restart option
difficulty: Difficulty increases naturally as grid space becomes limited.
Larger and more complex block shapes increase challenge over time.
No timers or pressure mechanics—players control the space.
visualDesign: Clean, colorful block visuals for strong readability
Clear animations when placing blocks and clearing lines
Satisfying effects to reinforce successful moves
